content:
The Ridge Trail and Schuylkill River Trail are a great combination for a fun and scenic ride.

For the Ridge Trail, a hardtail mountain bike would be sufficient. The trail is a mix of smooth dirt roads, singletrack, and some rocky sections, but it's not extremely technical or rugged. A hardtail bike with decent tires and some suspension in the front fork should be able to handle the terrain.

If you have a full-suspension mountain bike, you can definitely bring it, and it will provide more comfort and control on the rougher sections. However, it's not necessary, and a hardtail will still be a great choice.

Make sure to check the tire pressure and condition of your tires before heading out, as the trail can be rough in some areas. You may also want to consider bringing a spare tube, tire levers, and a pump or CO2 cartridges, just in case.

Additionally, consider the following:

* Wear comfortable, breathable clothing and shoes with good grip, as you'll be riding on dirt trails.
* Bring plenty of water, snacks, and sunscreen, as the ride can take around 2-3 hours.
* Pack a basic tool kit with Allen wrenches, screwdrivers, and a chain breaker, in case you need to make any adjustments or repairs.
* Bring a map or GPS device, as cell phone reception might be limited in the area.
* Let someone know your route and estimated return time, and consider riding with a buddy if possible.

Have a great ride, and enjoy the scenic views of the Schuylkill River and surrounding mountains!
